channel.title: Help please ;( PLEASE LOOK I BEG YA!
channel.description:
Hey, I had this server im editing JUST FINE earlier and now its just.. messed up
I dont remember the last thing i was editing i was just changing names and stuff and i changed somethign and compiled.. the compiler worked FINE but when i ran the client i got an error saying this: it pops up that screen saying
Sorry, an error has occured whilst loading Runescape.
TO fix this try the following ( in order ):
1: Try closing and reopening the client and/or web broswer 2: try clearing your web-broswers cache from tools -> internet options 3: Try rebooting your computer
also in the run.bat it says this: The system cannot find the path specified Sickscape Reloaded is loading. . Java.Lang.NegativeArraySizeException at client.drawlogo<client.java:3723> at client.startUp<client.java:8487> at RSApplet.run<RSAppley.java:33> at client.run<client.java:5752> at java.lang.thread.run<unknown Source> Error: Loaderror starting up 20
Dont really mind the system cannot fnid path specified.. it said that WHEN it was working.. >.> idk why it says that if u know just tell me that 2 plz :D?
Any suggestions?

item.title: Help please ;( PLEASE LOOK I BEG YA!
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

You learn something new every day Thanks man.

item.title: Help please ;( PLEASE LOOK I BEG YA!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Marine5287:

Well I’m not much of a coder, as a few people know, so I’m just saying to do this to not have this mistake next time. Sorry.

Besides, the error is most likely cause by something like this:

int[] pixelData = new int[byteStream.readInt()];

So the IDE, nor the compiler would report an error, because it doesn’t know if the byte being read is negative or not. That’s a runtime error.

Read full topic
item.source: Help please ;( PLEASE LOOK I BEG YA!

item.title: Help please ;( PLEASE LOOK I BEG YA!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:2, topic:393138”]1: Always use an IDE like Eclipse for editing-it picks up errors
2: When putting a code down, put it in the code format, less space
I learned this lesson a long time ago[/quote]

And you gave no information on the error, nor how to fix it.

The error basically says that you (or the client) is declaring an array with a negative size (most likely -1). It looks like when you’re loading/drawing the the logo, the size may be being read as a negative number.

Read full topic
